briefdescription.para: A unique identifier for this SceneNode, computed automatically during instantiation.

Boolean flag to represent the dirty-state of this node. Should be set to false if the current `worldTransform_` for this node was computed, otherwise true, e.g. if the node's local transform has been changed.
A shared pointer to the Renderable this node represents in the SceneGraph. May be nullptr if this node does not represent a renderable object.
The parent node of **this** node. This will be nullptr for any root node. Implementing APIs must take care of properly assigning parent nodes when adding child nodes.
A list of unique pointers to this node's children. Ensures ownership of the child nodes withing the graph hierarchy.
The 4x4 worldTransform-Matrix of this node. This matrix is initially set to the identity matrix. Implementing APIs MUST make sure to recompute the worldTransform before each rendering pass.
A local transformation representing affine transformation information for this SceneNode. Encapsulates rotation, scaling and translation.
Boolean flag indicating whether this SceneNode should be considered for rendering.
The axis-aligned-bounding-box for this SceneNode in world-coordinates.
Flags controlling which transform components are inherited from the parent node.

detaileddescription.para: By default set to `TransformType::All`, meaning translation, rotation, and scale are all inherited from the parent's world transform. Use `setInheritance()` to selectively disable inheritance of specific components.

briefdescription.para: Sets the parent of this SceneNode. Internally used once a child was added to this SceneNode.
Delete copy constructor. A SceneNode is not copyable.
Delete copy assignment operator.

detaileddescription.para: A SceneNode is not intended to be copied.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new SceneNode that represents no renderable object. Nodes constructed in this way should be treated as transformation nodes.

xrefdescription.para: explicitly implement move (assignment) constructor if required, since we have deleted the copy constructors

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new SceneNode that represents no renderable object. Nodes constructed in this way should be treated as transformation nodes.

parameterdescription.para: The initial transformation for this node.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new SceneNode representing a renderable object.

parameterdescription.para: A shared_ptr to the Renderable this SceneNode represents in a Scene.
The initial local transform for this node.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new SceneNode representing a renderable object.

parameterdescription.para: A shared_ptr to the Renderable this SceneNode represents in a Scene.

briefdescription.para: Returns the globally unique identifier for this SceneNode.

simplesect.para: The unique identifier for this SceneNode.

briefdescription.para: Adds a new child node to this SceneNode. The node's parent is automatically set to **this** node.

parameterdescription.para: The node to add as a child.

simplesect.para: The raw pointer to the newly added node, or nullptr if adding failed

briefdescription.para: Returns a const ref to the list of this node's children.

simplesect.para: A const ref to the list of children of this node.

briefdescription.para: Returns a shared pointer to the Renderable of this SceneNode.

simplesect.para: A shared_ptr to the Renderable, may be nullptr if none is set.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this SceneNode was configured with a Renderable.

simplesect.para: true if the SceneNode was configured with a Renderable, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Returns a shared pointer to the non-const Renderable of this SceneNode.

simplesect.para: A shared_ptr to the Renderable, may be nullptr if none is set.

briefdescription.para: Applies a scaling transformation to this node's **local** transform. Marks the node dirty. Implementing APIs should consider updating the worldTransform of this node before rendering.

parameterdescription.para: The helios::math::vec3f representing the node's scaling factors.

simplesect.para: A reference to this SceneNode.

briefdescription.para: Applies rotation to this node's **local** transform. Marks the node dirty. Implementing APIs should consider updating the worldTransform of this node before rendering.

simplesect.para: A reference to this SceneNode.

briefdescription.para: Applies translation to this node's **local** transform. Marks the node dirty. Implementing APIs should consider updating the worldTransform of this node before rendering.

parameterdescription.para: The helios::math::vec3f representing the node's translation.

simplesect.para: A reference to this SceneNode.

briefdescription.para: Returns this SceneNode's localTransform.

simplesect.para: A const reference to this SceneNode's `Transform` object.

briefdescription.para: Returns this SceneNode's localTransform.

simplesect.para: A reference to this SceneNode's `Transform` object.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to this node's parent node.

simplesect.para: The pointer to this node's parent, or nullptr if no parent exists, e.g. for the root node.

briefdescription.para: Sets the world transform for this SceneNode.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if the current SceneNode's world transform is considered equal to the specified world transform.

parameterdescription.para: The worldTransform to use for this SceneNode.
The sceneGraphKey as constructed by the `Scene`. Serves as the passkey so this method is not callable from outside.

simplesect.para: true if the world transform was updated, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Computes and returns the world transform for this SceneNode. Will request the current world transform from the parent node to calculate this SceneNode's world transform. For efficiency, this method should cache the result and only trigger a recompute if this SceneNode is dirty (`needsUpdate_ == true`).

simplesect.para: The current world transform matrix for this scene node.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current worldTransform matrix of this SceneNode **without triggering any recomputation**. This method is efficient for access when the world transform is known to be up-to-date.

simplesect.para: The current worldTransform matrix of this SceneNode.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether this SceneNode needs to be updated.

detaileddescription.para: The SceneNode is considered "dirty" if either the `localTransform_` needs an update, or if the `needsUpdate_` property is set to true.

simplesect.para: true if this SceneNode is considered to be dirty, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Returns the axis-aligned bounding box for this SceneNode in world coordinates.

simplesect.para: The AABB transformed to world space.

briefdescription.para: Updates the world transform and axis-aligned bounding box of this SceneNode.

detaileddescription.para: Recomputes the `worldTransform_` based on the parent's world transform and this node's `localTransform_`. Also updates the `aabb_` to reflect the current world-space bounds.

briefdescription.para: Virtual callback invoked after the world transform has been updated.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes can override this method to perform additional processing when the node's world transform changes, such as updating dependent resources or triggering view matrix recalculations in camera nodes.

briefdescription.para: Filters a parent world transform based on the node's inheritance flags.

detaileddescription.para: This method extracts only the transform components (Translation, Rotation, Scale) that this node is configured to inherit from its parent. Components not included in `inheritance_` are replaced with identity values.

simplesect.para: A filtered transform matrix containing only the inherited components.

briefdescription.para: Sets which transform components this node inherits from its parent.

detaileddescription.para: By default, nodes inherit all transform components (`TransformType::All`). Use this method to selectively inherit only Translation, Rotation, or Scale, enabling behaviors like cameras that follow an object's position but maintain independent orientation.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current transform inheritance flags for this node.

simplesect.para: The active inheritance mask.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether this SceneNode and its child nodes should be considered for rendering.

simplesect.para: true if the SceneNode should be considered for rendering, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Sets the active state of this SceneNode.

detaileddescription.para: The active state determines whether the SceneNode should be considered for rendering.

parameterdescription.para: true to consider this SceneNodefor rendering, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Represents a SceneNode within a SceneGraph.

detaileddescription.para: A SceneNode holds its local transformation and a (shared) pointer to a Renderable object (the representative of a visible element). Furthermore, a SceneNode can have multiple child nodes uniquely owned by **this** SceneNode.

A SceneNode holds a global unique identifier and tracks a dirty state (`needsUpdate_`) related to any transformations that occurred on the SceneNode. Ownership is managed by a collection of unique pointers of the child nodes. SceneNodes are designed to be not copyable and not assignable to prevent duplication and to enforce the hierarchical tree structure.

The `worldTransform_` is derived from a SceneNode's `localTransform_` and the SceneNode's parent's `worldTransform`s. A call to `worldTransform()` will update the particular subtree of the SceneNode bottom-up to make sure the actual values are available with the SceneNode's `worldTransform`. A Scene might also propagate changes top-bottom - see `Scene::updateNodes()`.
